reasoning: Seronegative myasthenia gravis (anti-AChR and anti-MuSK negative) represents ~5-10% of MG cases. Total MG incidence ~15-20 per 100k, so seronegative ~1-2 per 100k.
source: Vincent A et al. (2003). Seronegative myasthenia gravis: clinical features, antibodies, and prognosis. Ann N Y Acad Sci. 998:494-507
